com.serena.dmclient.api
Class DimensionsConnectionManager

java.lang.Object
  com.serena.dmclient.api.DimensionsConnectionManager

public class DimensionsConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object

Handles connection management by creating connections to the Dimensions and by providing a central registry of thread-specific connections.

Method Detail

getConnection

public static DimensionsConnection getConnection(DimensionsConnectionDetails details)
Create a new connection to the specified Dimensions server. To use this method, a caller would instantiate a DimensionsConnectionDetails object, configure it using its setter methods, then pass it to this method to obtain a new DimensionsConnection instance. 
 DimensionsConnectionDetails details = new DimensionsConnectionDetails();
 details.setUsername("johns");
 details.setPassword("!@johns");
 details.setDbName("intermediate");
 details.setDbConn("dim9");
 details.setServer("localhost:672");
 DimensionsConnection conn = DimensionsConnectionManager.getConnection(details);

NOTE: Although not enforced, Serena recommends that you do not attempt to establish multiple concurrent connections to a single base database as this will produce unpredictable results.

Parameters:
details - specifies what Dimensions server to connect to and authentication details
Returns:
the new connection to Dimensions.
Throws:
LoginFailedException - if the supplied DimensionsConnectionDetails object contains invalid login credentials
DimensionsNetworkException - if there is a network communications problem.
See Also:
DimensionsConnection, DimensionsConnectionDetails

cleanupConnection

protected static void cleanupConnection(DimensionsConnection connection)
Closes the specified connection and unregisters any threads that are registered to it.

Parameters:
connection - the connection that should be closed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if connection is null

getThreadConnection

public static DimensionsConnection getThreadConnection()
Finds the connection registered to the current thread.

Returns:
the DimensionsConnection instance registered to this Thread or null if no connection is registered to the current thread.

registerThreadConnection

public static void registerThreadConnection(DimensionsConnection conn)
Registers a connection to the current thread.

Parameters:
conn - the DimensionsConnection instance to register to this Thread.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if another DimensionsConnection has already been registered to this thread.
java.lang.NullPointerException - if conn is null.

unregisterThreadConnection

public static void unregisterThreadConnection()
Removes the DimensionsConnection instance registered to this Thread.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no DimensionsConnection has been registered to this thread.

getClientVersion

public static java.lang.String getClientVersion()
The version number of this API. Versions are '.' separated sequences of numbers. For example, "10.1.0" would refer to version 10.1.0 of the Dimensions Java client API.

Returns:
the version number as a String.

getInternalBuildNumber

protected static java.lang.String getInternalBuildNumber()

getVersionHintForConfiguration

public static java.lang.String getVersionHintForConfiguration()
A convenience method to provide a hint to automatic configuration mechanisms as to the major version of Dimensions that the API is compatible with.

The version number returned is NOT a definitive guide as to which versions of a Dimensions server the API will work with.

Returns:
A version number as a String in the form ...

setThreadConnection

protected static DimensionsConnection setThreadConnection(DimensionsConnection prevailingConnection)
Ensures that the calling thread is registered to the local connection object.

If the calling thread is not registered to the prevailing connection, switch the calling thread to be registered with the prevailing connection. The effect of this method may be reversed using unsetThreadConnection(DimensionsConnection).

Parameters:
prevailingConnection - the connection that the calling thread must be registered with
Returns:
the connection that was already registered to the calling thread at the start of the method, if any.

unsetThreadConnection

protected static void unsetThreadConnection(DimensionsConnection connectionToRegister)
Reverses the effect of a call to setThreadConnection(DimensionsConnection).

Ensures the calling thread becomes unregistered from whatever connection it is registered to and re-registers the calling thread to the specified connection.

Parameters:
connectionToRegister - the connection to which the calling thread must be registered.

setDebugLogFile

public static void setDebugLogFile(java.lang.String component,
                                   java.lang.String file,
                                   int logLevel)
Sets the log file name and the log level for certain underlying components of the Java API. This method has to be called before any connection has been retrieved! This method should only be called once!

Parameters:
component - Currently the two supported components are "cmd" and "net". These components are subject to change in later versions
file - The file name where the debug information is written to
logLevel - If logLevel = 0, no debug information is written. If logLevel > 0, debug information is written. Subject to change. The format of the respective log files are subject to change.

setCharEncoding

public static void setCharEncoding(java.lang.String encoding)
Sets the character encoding to be returned if the server is not UTF-8. This method has to be called before a connection has been retrieved! This method sets the default encoding for all subsequent connections!

Parameters:
encoding - An encoding name to set as default.
